page.title: 19RELIGION IN DENBIGH.
page.content: There are seven religious denominations in the town{-Church of {Wales, Roman Catholics, Welsh {Presbyterians, English Methodists, {Baptist, Congregationalists, Wesleyan {and Jehovah's Witness. The places of worship for the Church of Wales are St.Mary's and St.Marcella's( a{Norman church}known as Whitchurch). Lon Swan, Capel Mawr and Pendref serve the Welsh Presbyterians with St.Thomas's for the English Methodists.The above buildings are made from local{limestone}in traditional styles.St.Joseph's(Roman Catholic),however, is of concrete construction and modern in design. Research has shown that attendance at a place of worship is more prevalent amongst Welsh speaking junior school children.
